Dear Ms. Shell:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violation identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The corrective
action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (517) 899-6024.
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff qualifications
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff hit youth in the face multiple times.
Investigation On 7/1/2024 the agency self-reported an incident between Staff 1
and Youth A. Per Complainant, on 6/28/24 Youth A was trying to
make a phone call and became disrespectful with Staff 1. Youth A
hit Staff 1. Staff 1 responded by hitting Youth A in the face with a
closed hand. There were no injuries to Youth A. The complaint
was assigned to an MDHHS Worker on 7/1/24. On 7/2/24 the
complaint was reconsidered and determined the MDHHS Worker
would not be involved.
Foster Care Worker was contacted via email on 7/1/24. Foster
Care Worker reported they did not have any additional information
about the incident.
Quality Manager was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
7/2/24. Quality Manager reported a video of the incident was
available, which showed that Youth A hit Staff 1 with a plastic
grocery bag, believed to contain a bottle. Staff 1 reacted by hitting
Youth A in the face. Staff 1 was immediately removed from the
area and admitted to other staff that she hit Youth A. Staff 1 was
placed on leave, pending investigation.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 7/2/24.
Youth A reported that Staff 1 hit her in the eye on 6/28/24. Youth
A indicated she had a dark bruise under her eye, but it had faded.
Youth A was observed to have some darkness under her right
eye. Youth A stated she was supposed to call her caseworker that
day, but staff said she needed to go out to the staff desk to make
the phone call. Youth A was upset because she wanted to stay in
bed to make the call. When Youth A went out to the staff desk,
she stated that staff did not know how to do their jobs. Staff 1 told
Youth A to “shut up”. Youth A became angry and picked up a bag
with someone’s lunch in it and swung the bag at Staff 1. The bag
2

of items hit Staff 1 in the head. Staff 1 responded by punching
Youth A in the face. Additional staff stepped in and separated
Youth A and Staff 1. Youth A reported there were several staff
present that witnessed the incident. Youth A stated she could only
recall one peer that was present, Youth B. Youth A reported she
felt safe at the facility and had no prior issues with Staff 1. Youth A
did not have any concerns about the way the other staff handled
the incident, as they separated Youth A and Staff 1.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 7/2/24.
Youth B reported she was aware of the alleged incident on
6/28/24 but did not see it happen. Youth B entered the room after
she heard a commotion. Youth B reported she was not aware of
any prior incidents involving Staff 1 and did not have any concerns
about her.
Program Coordinator was interviewed face-to-face at the facility
on 7/11/24. Program Coordinator was not present during the
alleged incident. However, he did review the video footage and
provided it to DCWL. It was determined that Staff 1 would not
return to the facility.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 7/11/24. On
6/28/24 Staff 2 observed Youth A to be disrespectful and swearing
at Staff 1. Youth A was upset because she did not get to take the
unit phone into her room to make a call. Staff 2 explained that
none of the youth are allowed to take the phone into their rooms.
Youth A stood at the staff desk and called Staff 1 names. Staff 1
laughed, which seemed to upset Youth A. Youth A then grabbed
a plastic grocery bag that was sitting on the counter and swung it
at Staff 1’s face. The bag held a full beverage bottle and hit Staff
1. Staff 1 reacted by hitting Youth A in the face. Additional staff
stepped in and put themselves between Staff 1 and Youth A. Due
to the noise, residents left their rooms to see what happened.
Youth B became upset and tried to go after Youth A. Some staff
ushered the other youth back to their rooms, while two staff spoke
with Youth A. Youth A tried to get past staff to go after Staff 1.
Therefore, staff attempted a standing restraint but Youth A pulled
away and dropped to the ground to get away from staff. Youth A
laid on the floor, kicking at staff. Staff 1 was moved out of the unit,
which seemed to help Youth A calm down. Youth A was then
taken back to her room and checked for injuries.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 7/11/24.
Staff 3 reported she was present for the alleged incident. Staff 3
was standing at a side door, talking to Youth A. Youth A had been
3

in her room all day and came out with an attitude, because she
wanted her phone call right then. Staff 3 explained to Youth A that
she needed to wait her turn. Suddenly, Youth A was standing
there, making a phone call. Shift change was also occurring at this
time. Staff 1 had set her belongings on the desk when she came
in. Another staff was sitting behind the desk, helping Youth A with
her call. Staff 1 began to write something down at the desk when
Youth A began yelling and swearing at her. Staff 1 asked Youth A
who she was talking to. Youth A responded by grabbing a
shopping bag from the desk and hit Staff 1 with it. Staff 1
responded by reaching out toward Youth A. Staff 3 got in between
and separated Youth A and Staff 1. Additional staff intervened
with Youth A, while Staff 3 walked Staff 1 away from the situation.
While walking Staff 3 asked Staff 1 if she was ok. Staff 1
responded she was ok, but appeared upset about her reaction,
indicating she thought she hit Youth A. Staff 3 escorted Staff 1 off
the unit. When Staff 3 returned to the unit, staff were still trying to
deescalate Youth A. Staff moved Youth A off the unit. Staff 3
began cleaning up and discovered the bag that hit Staff 1 had two
full bottles of juice and some snacks in it.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 7/11/24.
Staff 4 reported she was not present at the time of the incident but
entered the unit after the fact. When Staff 4 arrived on the unit
there was a lot of commotion. Staff 1 had left the area. Youth A
was in the conference room doorway, yelling and swearing at
staff. Some of the other residents were escalated and upset with
Youth A. There were several staff on the unit working to calm the
youth.
Staff 1 was interviewed by phone on 7/26/24. Staff 1 reported that
during the alleged incident, everything happened very quickly.
Staff 1 stated that she did swing her hand and hit Youth A, as a
reflex to being hit in the face. Staff 1 knew that action was not
appropriate and was remorseful during the interview.
Video review
The 6/28/24 video was provided to DCWL by the facility. The
video showed the following: Staff 1 was standing at the staff desk.
Youth A was standing adjacent to Staff 1, on the other side of the
desk. The video did not have audio available to determine any
words that were exchanged. However, Youth A grabbed a plastic
grocery bag that appeared to have something in it and swung it at
Staff 1, hitting her on or near her face. Staff 1 charged at Youth A,
hitting her in the face with her left hand. Additional staff intervened
and stood between Youth A and Staff 1. Staff 3 ushered Staff 1 to
4

the corner across the room. Additional staff blocked Youth A from
walking across the room. Youth A attempted to push through staff.
Staff then attempted to place Youth A in a standing hold, but
Youth A ducked under staff and went to the ground. Youth A
began kicking staff. Staff backed away. Youth A then got up and
started throwing shoes at Staff 1 as she left the unit. Staff
continued to block Youth A until Staff 1 was off the unit. Youth A
was then walked back to her room.
Documents reviewed
• Foster Care case record for Youth A was reviewed. The
youth has been at the facility for nine months. During that
time, she had several incident reports related to behavior.
No additional information relevant to the investigation was
found.
• Nursing Assessment dated 6/28/24 indicated Youth A had
scratches to her wrist, which she admitted to scratching
intentionally when upset after the alleged incident. No eye
injury was noted. Youth A refused ice and pain medication.
• Incident report dated 6/28/24 was consistent with
information provided by witnesses and observed in the
video.
• Human resources file for Staff 1 indicated prior disciplinary
action regarding attendance and use of a cell phone on
shift. No prior concerns related to Staff 1’s interactions with
youth. Staff 1 was suspended on 6/28/24 after the alleged
incident. Staff 1 was terminated officially on 7/10/24.
Analysis A violation was found as interviews with Staff 1 and witnesses,
and the video footage confirmed that Youth A hit Staff 1 and Staff
1 responded by hitting Youth A in the face.
Conclusion Violation Established
5

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. A Corrective Action Plan is required.

sir_summary.summary: A youth, Youth A, became upset while trying to make a phone call and struck a staff member, Staff 1, in the head with a plastic bag containing bottles. Staff 1 retaliated by punching Youth A in the face, an act confirmed by witness interviews and video footage. Staff 1 was immediately removed, placed on leave, and later terminated. While the youth initiated physical contact, primary culpability lies with Staff 1 for the unprofessional and prohibited retaliatory strike.
